actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Rules.

official_title: Resolution creating a Select Committee on Energy.

summary.text: Creates a 22-member Select Committee on Energy. States that the function of such select committee shall be: (1) to review any bill relating to the development of any form of energy which has been referred to any committee; and (2) to consider and report a bill to the House of Representatives designated to make the United States self-sufficient in energy. Gives the select committee the authority and staff necessary to carry out the provisions of this resolution. Provides that the expenses of the select committee shall be paid from the contingent fund of the House. Directs that the select committee shall expire upon the completion of the legislative process with respect to the bill reported by such select committee, or upon termination of the 94th Congress, whichever is earlier.

titles.title: Resolution creating a Select Committee on Energy.
